root.skills_to_be_learned_on_the_course_1: Basic theory (What is testing, bug reports, documentation, types, methods, testing directions, etc.) SDLC, STLC
root.skills_to_be_learned_on_the_course_3: HTTP Methods of requests to the server
root.skills_to_be_learned_on_the_course_5: Structures of HTTP requests and responses
root.skills_to_be_learned_on_the_course_6: What is JSON, XML. Their structure
root.skills_to_be_learned_on_the_course_7: API testing via Postman (JS, API autotests)
root.skills_to_be_learned_on_the_course_8: Removing and reading logs from an external server
root.skills_to_be_learned_on_the_course_9: Sniffing http web traffic via Charles and Fiddler
root.skills_to_be_learned_on_the_course_10: Dev Tools of web browsers (Google Chrome, FireFox)
root.skills_to_be_learned_on_the_course_11: VPN. (How it works, why you need it, how to use it, tool options)
root.skills_to_be_learned_on_the_course_15: Building Android applications on Android Studio
root.skills_to_be_learned_on_the_course_17: Setting up proxy and vpn on iOS and Android
root.skills_to_be_learned_on_the_course_18: Interception (sniffing) of mobile traffic via Charles and Fiddler on iOS and Android
root.skills_to_be_learned_on_the_course_19: Command line (terminal) Linux (copying, creating, viewing, moving files on servers without a graphical interface)
root.skills_to_be_learned_on_the_course_20: Basics of bash scripting, automation of routine tasks on the server
root.skills_to_be_learned_on_the_course_22: SQL basics (Create, Delete, Drop, Insert Into, Select, From, Where, Join)
root.skills_to_be_learned_on_the_course_24: Non-relational database Redis (installation, configuration and use)
root.skills_to_be_learned_on_the_course_27: Python. (Learning the basics. Creating a client-server application)
